data.enText: condition of sb/sth
the mental, emotional or physical condition that a person or thing is in
a confused state of mind
He was in a state of permanent depression.

data.chText: 对于国家经济状况的担忧
data.enText: anxieties about the state of the country's economy
The building is in a bad state of repair (= needs to be repaired) .
She was in a state of shock .

data.chText: 看看你这副样子！你可不能就这么出去。
data.enText: Look at the state of you! You can't go out looking like that.

data.chText: 你现在的状态不宜开车。
data.enText: You're not in a fit state to drive.
country
a country considered as an organized political community controlled by one government
the Baltic States
European Union member states
part of country
an organized political community forming part of a country

data.chText: 维多利亚和西澳大利亚两州
data.enText: the states of Victoria and Western Australia
the southern states of the US
government
the government of a country
matters/affairs of state
people who are financially dependent on the state
a state-owned company

data.chText: 他们希望限制政府权力。
data.enText: They wish to limit the power of the State.
official ceremony

data.chText: （国家元首或政府首脑享受的）正式礼仪，隆重仪式
data.enText: the formal ceremonies connected with high levels of government or with kings and queens

data.chText: 总统乘车隆重地从街上穿过。
data.enText: The president was driven in state through the streets.
the US
the United States of America
I've never been to the States.
be in/get into a state
to be/become excited or anxious
She was in a real state about her exams.
to be dirty or untidy
What a state this place is in!
in a state of grace

data.chText: （罗马天主教指灵魂上没有大罪的状态）受天主眷爱，蒙受恩宠
data.enText: (in the Roman Catholic Church) having been forgiven by God for the wrong or evil things you have done
a state of affairs
a situation

data.chText: 再不能无视这种情况了。
data.enText: This state of affairs can no longer be ignored.
the state of play
the stage that has been reached in a process, etc. which has not yet been completed

data.chText: 和平谈判目前进展得怎么样？
data.enText: What is the current state of play in the peace talks?
the score in a sports match, especially in cricket
State
government
provided or controlled by the government of a country
state education

data.chText: 靠政府救济金生活的家庭
data.enText: families dependent on state benefits (= in Britain, money given by the government to people who are poor)
state secrets (= information that could be harmful to a country if it were discovered by an enemy)
official
connected with the leader of a country attending an official ceremony

data.chText: 女王正对莫斯科进行国事访问。
data.enText: The Queen is on a state visit to Moscow.
the state opening of Parliament
the state apartments (= used for official ceremonies)
part of country
connected with a particular state of a country, especially in the US

data.chText: 州监狱、州立医院、州立大学等
data.enText: a state prison/hospital/university, etc.
state police/troopers
a state tax
to formally write or say sth, especially in a careful and clear way

data.chText: 他已声明打算参加竞选。
data.enText: He has already stated his intention to run for election.

data.chText: 报道对事实真相作了清楚的说明。
data.enText: The facts are clearly stated in the report.

data.chText: 显而易见的事实就不必陈述了。
data.enText: There is no need to state the obvious (= to say sth that everyone already knows) .

data.chText: 说清楚你需要多少张票。
data.enText: State clearly how many tickets you require.

data.chText: 他明确表示他对协议的事一无所知。
data.enText: He stated categorically that he knew nothing about the deal.

data.chText: 据称，那家医院的医疗水准在不断下降。
data.enText: It was stated that standards at the hospital were dropping.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The contract was stated to be invalid.

data.text: This pattern is usually used in the passive.
此句型通常用于被动语态。

data.enText: to fix or announce the details of sth, especially on a written document

data.chText: 在他们宣布的目标里没有这一条。
data.enText: This is not one of their stated aims.

data.chText: 你必须在规定时间到达。
data.enText: You must arrive at the time stated.
Do not exceed the stated dose (= of medicine) .

data.chText: 下列形容词常与这两个名词连用：
data.enText: The following adjectives are frequently used with these nouns.

data.chText: state较condition通用，指特定时间的状况，可不加形容词：
data.enText: State is a more general word than condition and is used for the condition that something is in at a particular time. It can be used without an adjective.
the present state of medical knowledge

data.chText: 我们担心他的精神状况。
data.enText: We’re worried about his mental state.
What a state this room is in (= very bad) .

data.chText: condition与形容词连用，尤指人或事物的外观、品质或工作状况：
data.enText: Condition is used with an adjective and refers especially to the appearance, quality or working order of somebody or something.

data.chText: 这辆汽车的车况好极了。
data.enText: The car is in excellent condition.

data.chText: 以上各词均含表明、宣称、宣布之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to say sth, usually firmly and clearly and often in public.
declare
( rather formal ) to say sth officially or publicly; to state sth firmly and clearly
to declare war
The painting was declared to be a forgery.
state
( rather formal ) to formally write or say sth, especially in a careful and clear way

data.chText: 他已声明打算参加竞选。
data.enText: He has already stated his intention to run for election.
indicate
( rather formal ) to state sth, sometimes in a way that is slightly indirect

data.chText: 在我们会晤期间，他提及了合作的意愿。
data.enText: During our meeting, he indicated his willingness to cooperate.
announce

data.chText: 指宣布、宣告、（通过广播）通知：
data.enText: to tell people officially about a decision or plans; to give information about sth in a public place, especially through a loudspeaker; to say sth in a loud and/or serious way

data.chText: 他们还没有正式宣布订婚。
data.enText: They haven't formally announced their engagement yet.

data.chText: 广播通知了我们的航班没有？
data.enText: Has our flight been announced yet?

data.chText: declare较常用于表明意见、看法；announce较常用于说明事实：
data.enText: Declare is used more often for giving judgements; announce is used more often for giving facts.
The painting was announced to be a forgery.
They haven't formally declared their engagement yet.
declare or announce?
to declare/state/indicate/announce that…
to declare/state sb/sth to be sth
to declare/state/indicate/announce your intention to do sth
to declare/state/announce sth formally/publicly/officially
to declare/state/announce sth firmly/clearly/plainly

data.chText: country是指国家的最普通的中性词。
data.enText: Country is the most usual, neutral word for a geographical area that has or used to have its own government.

data.chText: state侧重指独立政府统治下的政权机构，尤其在英国英语中，该词亦可指政府：
data.enText: State emphasizes the political organization of an area under an independent government. Especially in BrE , it can also mean the government.
the member states of the EU
The state provides free education.

data.chText: 在北美英语中，the state通常指美国50个州中的一个州，而非指作为一个整体的国家政府。
data.enText: In NAmE the state usually refers to one of the 50 states of the US, not to the government of the country as a whole.

ex.chText: 中国是一个幅员辽阔的国家。
劳务输出在发展中国家非常普遍。
ex.enText: Labour export is very common in developing countries.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，侧重指国土、疆域。

ex.chText: 联合王国由大不列颠和北爱尔兰组成。
ex.enText: The United Kingdom consists of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

ex.chText: 国王是王国中最重要的人物。
ex.enText: The king is the most important person in a kingdom.

synonyms.bx: 指由国王或女王统治的国家，或君主立宪的国家。

ex.chText: 新西兰是一个讲英语的国家。
ex.enText: New Zealand is an English speaking nation.

ex.chText: 美国是世界上的主要工业国之一。
ex.enText: America is one of the world's leading industrial nations.

synonyms.bx: 强调其民族、社会及经济结构。

ex.enText: The king sought to expand his realm.

synonyms.bx: 与 kingdom 基本同义，但多用于正式文体。

ex.chText: 铁路应该由国家控制吗？
ex.enText: Should railways be controlled by the state?

ex.chText: 政府为公务员建立了医疗补助制度。
ex.enText: The state has set up a medical subsidy program for civil servants.

synonyms.bx: 侧重指被视为政治组织的国家，英国英语中尤指政府。

data.enText: be in/get into a state
to be/become excited or anxious
She was in a real state about her exams.
to be dirty or untidy
What a state this place is in!
in a state of grace

data.chText: （罗马天主教指灵魂上没有大罪的状态）受天主眷爱，蒙受恩宠
data.enText: (in the Roman Catholic Church) having been forgiven by God for the wrong or evil things you have done
a state of affairs
a situation

data.chText: 再不能无视这种情况了。
data.enText: This state of affairs can no longer be ignored.
the state of play
the stage that has been reached in a process, etc. which has not yet been completed

data.chText: 和平谈判目前进展得怎么样？
data.enText: What is the current state of play in the peace talks?
the score in a sports match, especially in cricket

tr: the way something is with respect to its main attributes
example: the current state of knowledge
his state of health
in a weak financial state

tr: a politically organized body of people under a single government
example: the state has elected a new president
African nations
students who had come to the nation's capitol
the country's largest manufacturer
an industrialized land

tr: the group of people comprising the government of a sovereign state
example: the state has lowered its income tax

tr: the territory occupied by a nation
example: he returned to the land of his birth
he visited several European countries

tr: the territory occupied by one of the constituent administrative districts of a nation
example: his state is in the deep south

tr: a state of depression or agitation
example: he was in such a state you just couldn't reason with him

tr: (chemistry) the three traditional states of matter are solids (fixed shape and volume) and liquids (fixed volume and shaped by the container) and gases (filling the container)
example: the solid state of water is called ice
I submit to you that the accused is guilty
He said that he wanted to marry her
tell me what is bothering you
state your opinion
state your name

tr: indicate through a symbol, formula, etc.
example: Can you express this distance in kilometers?

value.def: You can refer to countries as states, particularly when you are discussing politics.

example.ex: Mexico is a secular state and does not have diplomatic relations with the Vatican...
example.tran: 墨西哥是个世俗国家，和梵蒂冈没有外交关系。

example.ex: Some weeks ago I recommended to EU member states that we should have discussions with the Americans.
example.tran: 几周前，我曾向欧盟成员国提议我们应该和美国人进行磋商。

value.tran: (尤用于讨论政治事务时)国家

value.def: Some large countries such as the USA are divided into smaller areas called states .

example.ex: Leaders of the Southern states are meeting in Louisville.
example.tran: 南部一些州的领导正在路易斯维尔开会。

value.def: The USA is sometimes referred to as the States .
You can refer to the government of a country as the state .

example.ex: The state does not collect enough revenue to cover its expenditure...
Eastern Europe shows that worker-owned factories can be as inefficient as state-owned ones.
example.tran: 东欧的经验表明，工人所有的工厂可能和国有工厂一样效率低下。

value.def: State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies.

example.tran: 对国家社会保障制度的改革

value.def: A state occasion is a formal one involving the head of a country.

example.ex: ...the Queen's three-day state visit to France.
example.tran: 女王对法国为期 3 天的国事访问

value.def: When you talk about the state of someone or something, you are referring to the condition they are in or what they are like at a particular time.

example.ex: For the first few months after Daniel died, I was in a state of clinical depression...
example.tran: 丹尼尔去世后的最初几个月里，我一直处于临床抑郁症的状态。

example.ex: When we moved here the walls and ceiling were in an awful state...
example.tran: 我们刚搬到这里时，墙和房顶都破旧不堪。

example.ex: Look at the state of my car!
example.tran: 看看我的车都成什么样子了！

value.def: If you state something, you say or write it in a formal or definite way.

example.ex: Clearly state your address and telephone number...
example.tran: 清楚地报上你的地址和电话号码。

example.ex: The police report stated that he was arrested for allegedly assaulting his wife...
example.tran: 警方的报告称，他因涉嫌殴打妻子而被捕。

example.ex: 'Our relationship is totally platonic,' she stated...
example.tran: “我们纯属精神恋爱，”她声明道。

example.ex: Buyers who do not apply within the stated period can lose their deposits.
example.tran: 未能在规定期限内提出申请的买家可能会拿不回押金。

value.tran: (以口头或书面形式正式或明确地)声称，宣称，声明

xrsa.xrsa_see: head of state;nation state;police state;welfare state

value.def: If you say that someone is not in a fit state to do something, you mean that they are too upset or ill to do it.

example.ex: When you left our place, you weren't in a fit state to drive.
example.tran: 你离开我们家时已经开不了车了。

value.tran: (因精神或健康状态不佳而)不适宜(做某事)

value.def: If you are in a state or if you get into a state, you are very upset or nervous about something.

example.ex: I was in a terrible state because nobody could understand why I had this illness...
example.tran: 我极度焦虑不安，因为谁也不知道为什么我会得这个病。

example.ex: People will work themselves up into a state about anything.
example.tran: 人们总会沉不住气，为任何事感到担忧。

value.def: If the dead body of an important person lies in state, it is publicly displayed for a few days before it is buried.
value.tran: (重要人物的遗体)停放供瞻仰
